newsitem.title: FRANCE: Publicis buys majority in Canada's BCP.
newsitem.headline: Publicis buys majority in Canada's BCP.

text.p: French advertising agency Publicis said on Wednesday it had bought 70 percent of BCP, Canada's seventh largest advertising and communications group.
BCP's rank is based on its billings of C$248 million (US$181 million), Publicis said in a statement.

"Publicis now has a direct presence throughout the North American continent, in line with our strategy of assuring our own service to our clients worldwide," Publicis chairman and chief executive Maurice Levy said in the company statement.

The Canadian agency will be named Publicis-BCP and will continue to be managed by Yves Gougoux, who has headed the company since 1984. It employs 200 staff in Toronto and Montreal and includes among its clients Molson Breweries, Club Mediterranee, Novotel, and Procter & Gamble.
Publicis had 1995 revenues of $720 million and posted a six percent increase in first half 1996 revenues.
